chapter.title: Description of raw images
chapter.para: &slema; raw images are delivered for the x86_64 architecture (an image with RT kernel is available), IBM ZSeries (an image of the KVM host, images to be used with FBA or DASD devices) and also AArch64. These images are intended to be configured on the first boot by using either Ignition or Combustion. To detect the first boot, each image contains a flag file that is recognized by the boot loader, see more in . Each image has default mounted subvolumes as described in . The procedure of deploying these images is described in .

sect1.title: Default partitioning
sect1.para: The raw images are delivered with a default partitioning scheme, which can be changed during the first boot by using Ignition or Combustion. For a procedure of repartitiong the system, refer to or .

important.title: Btrfs is mandatory for the root file system.
important.para: Bear in mind that if you intend to perform any changes to the default partitioning scheme, the root file system must be btrfs.

sect1.title: First boot detection
sect1.para: The configuration runs on the first boot only and to distinquish between the first and subsequent boots, the flag file —/boot/ignition.firstboot is used. If the file is detected, the attribute ignition.firstboot is passed to the kernel command line, which triggeres creating initramfs with Ignition or running the dracut module in case of Combustion. After completing the configuration on the first boot, the /boot/ignition.firstboot is deleted.
